      • getSaveType

        public Serializer.SaveType getSaveType()

      • saveObject

        public boolean saveObject(E object,
                 OutputStream out)
        Save the object to the given OuputStream. The style this object is saved is determined by the method getSaveType().
        Parameters:
        object - The object to save
        out - The OutputStream to write to.
        Returns:
        Whether the save was successful or not.

      • getObject

        public E getObject(InputStream in)
            throws IOException,
                   ClassNotFoundException
        Get the object from the InputStream provided. If the current save style is Serializer.SaveType.JSON, then please use the method getObject(InputStream, Class) otherwise an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from.
        Returns:
        The object read from the stream
        Throws:
        IOException - This exception can be thrown for 3 reason:
        1. If there was an error reading from the stream
        2. The current save style is json ( Please use getObject(InputStream, Class) to get json objects)
        3. The current save type is invalid
        ClassNotFoundException

      • getObject

        public E getObject(InputStream in,
          Class<E> class_)
            throws IOException,
                   ClassNotFoundException
        Get the object from the InputStream provided.
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from.
        class_ - The class for this object
        Returns:
        The object read from the stream
        Throws:
        IOException - This exception can be thrown for 2 reason:
        1. If there was an error reading from the stream
        2. The current save type is invalid
        ClassNotFoundException
